intro: Tanacetum aucherianum, commonly known as the golden buttons or yellow buttonweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe. It features a compact growth habit with dark green, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, bright yellow flowers arranged in flat-topped clusters, which bloom from late spring to early summer. Its aromatic foliage and showy inflorescences make it a popular choice for ornamental gardening. It prefers well-drained soil and full sun, though it can tolerate partial shade.
